tr_quotes.quote: Yaşamlarımızdaki her hareket sonsuzlukta titreyecek bazı tellere dokunur.
tr_quotes.author: Edwin Hubbell Chapin

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe yolda olmak demektir.
tr_quotes.author: Karl Jaspers

tr_quotes.quote: İlme dayanmayan felsefe, hayalciliktir.
tr_quotes.author: Ali Şeriati

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe öğrenilmez, yapılır.
tr_quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, utanmazlığın çağdaş biçimidir.
tr_quotes.author: Albert Camus

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, neleri bilmediğini bilmektir.
tr_quotes.author: Socrates

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, genelleştirilmiş bir matematiktir.
tr_quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

tr_quotes.quote: Boş vakit, felsefenin annesidir.
tr_quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, aklın sınırlarına işaret eder ve onları sözle çözmeye çalışır.
tr_quotes.author: Goethe

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, düşüncenin mikroskobudur.
tr_quotes.author: Victor Hugo

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, zaruri ve elzem vazifelerde, cılızlığımızı anlamakla başlar.
tr_quotes.author: Epiktetos

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe tüm bilimlerin ruhudur.
tr_quotes.author: Vincenzo Gioberti

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe inanılanın inanılmaya değer olup olmadığını araştırmaktır.
tr_quotes.author: Peter Abelard

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, koşulsuz sorgulamadır.
tr_quotes.author: Joseph Maistre

tr_quotes.quote: Zihin dönüp kendini incelemeye başlamadan gerçek felsefe yapılamaz.
tr_quotes.author: Platon

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe dilin eleştirisidir.
tr_quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe konusunda en yavaş konuşabilen kazanır, ya da bitişe en son varan.
tr_quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe aklımızın dille büyülenmesine karşı verilen bir savaştır.
tr_quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe kişilerin yaşamı merak etmesinden doğar. Yaşamı en çok merak eden çocuklardır.
tr_quotes.author: Aristo

tr_quotes.quote: Şaşma felsefenin temeli, soruşturma gelişmesi, bilgisizlik son aşamasıdır.
tr_quotes.author: Montaigne

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefesiz yaşamak sahip olunan bir çift kapalı gözü açmaya hiç tenezzül etmemektir.
tr_quotes.author: Descartes

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefeye sarılan kişinin aklı, akılla anlaşılabilen şeylere bağlanmış kalmıştır.
tr_quotes.author: Mevlana

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, dünyanın yaratılmasına yönelik en ruhsal güç istencinin amansız dürtüsüdür.
tr_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

tr_quotes.quote: Bilim, felsefenin başarılarından, felsefe de bilimin başarısızlıklarından örülmüştür.
tr_quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefeye inanmak, insanın düşünme yetisinin korku yüzünden körelmesine karcı çıkmaktır.
tr_quotes.author: Max Horheimer

tr_quotes.quote: Ben bilmediğimi bildiğim için, öteki insanlardan akıllıyım.
tr_quotes.author: Socrates

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe; bizi başkası için değil kendimiz için, güçlü görünmek için değil, güçlü olmak için yetiştirir.
tr_quotes.author: Montaigne

tr_quotes.quote: Kimseye kendinizi sevdirmeye kalkmayın, yapılması gereken tek şey, sadece kendinizi sevilmeye bırakmaktır.
tr_quotes.author: Platon

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe bir bilimdir ve geometrik yöntemi metafiziğe uygulamak gerekir, felsefeyi kesin bir bilim yapmak için.
tr_quotes.author: Descartes

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefenin insanlara, yaşamaya başlarken de, ölüme doğru giderken de söyleyecekleri vardır.
tr_quotes.author: Montaigne

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, ne kadar soğuksa itikat da o kadar sıcaktır, birinin kaynağı sönük mantık, diğerinin ise nurlu bir kalptir.
tr_quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

tr_quotes.quote: İyimserlik dinlerde olduğu gibi felsefede de gerçeklerin yerini almış temel bir yanılgıdır.
tr_quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

tr_quotes.quote: Biraz felsefe, insanın zihnini dinsizliğe meylettirir; felsefede derinleşmek, zihinleri dine yaklaştırır.
tr_quotes.author: Francis Bacon

tr_quotes.quote: Merak, bir filozofun en düşkün olduğu şeydir. Çünkü felsefenin bundan başka bir başlangıcı yoktur.
tr_quotes.author: Platon

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe bir ağaç gibidir, kökleri metafizik, gövdesi fiziktir. Gövdeden çıkan kollar da öteki bütün bilimlerdir.
tr_quotes.author: Descartes

tr_quotes.quote: Saf ve sağlam kalabilmiş bir ruh, gerçeğe ulaşmak ihtiyacını duyar. Felsefe ise, gerçeğin ülkesinde oturmaktadır.
tr_quotes.author: Hegel

tr_quotes.quote: Hikmet ve felsefe, geçmiş ve gelecek dertlerin kolaylıkla hakkından gelir; fakat bu günün dertleri de onun hakkından gelir.
tr_quotes.author: François de La Rochefaucauld

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefeyle uğraşma zamanının daha gelmediğini ya da artık geçmiş olduğunu söylemek, mutlu olmanın zamanı daha gelmedi ya da artık geçti demekten farksızdır.
tr_quotes.author: Epikür

tr_quotes.quote: Bilim, felsefenin başarılarından, felsefe de bilimin başarısızlıklarından örülmüştür.
tr_quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe; ne olursa olsun yapmaya zorlandığımız görevlerde, cılızlığımızı ve bilgisizliğimizi anlamak ile başlar.
tr_quotes.author: Epiktetos

tr_quotes.quote: Hayatta göreceğiniz iş ne olursa olsun, erdem olmayınca elde edeceğiniz her şeyin, yapacağınız her işin sonunda utanç ve kötülük vardır.
tr_quotes.author: Platon

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, zaruri ve elzem vazifelerde, cılızlığımızı anlamakla başlar.
tr_quotes.author: Epiktetos

tr_quotes.quote: Saf ve sağlam kalabilmiş bir ruh, gerçeğe ulaşmak ihtiyacını duyar. Felsefe ise, gerçeğin ülkesinde oturmaktadır.
tr_quotes.author: Hegel

tr_quotes.quote: Bütün felsefe kitapları kendin olmayı telkin eder. Ancak aydının trajedisi tam da bu noktada her an biraz daha yabancılaştığının farkına varmaktır.
tr_quotes.author: Cezmi Ersöz

tr_quotes.quote: İyimserlik dinlerde olduğu gibi felsefede de gerçeklerin yerini almış temel bir yanılgıdır.
tr_quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

tr_quotes.quote: Çocuklar en gözü pek filozoflardır. Ve gözü pek filozoflar da kaçınılmaz olarak çocuk kalırlar. Evet, tıpkı çocuklar gibi durmadan soru sorarlar.
tr_quotes.author: Yevgeniy İvanoviç Zamyetin

tr_quotes.quote: Boş vakit, felsefenin annesidir.
tr_quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

tr_quotes.quote: Sayfaların arasında gözyaşları, ağlama, dişlerin birbirine çarpması ve karşılıklı katletmenin korkunç gümbürtüsü olmayan felsefe, felsefe değildir.
tr_quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefeye sarılan kişinin aklı, akılla anlaşılabilen şeylere bağlanmış kalmıştır.
tr_quotes.author: Mevlana

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe; bizi başkası için değil kendimiz için, güçlü görünmek için değil, güçlü olmak için yetiştirir.
tr_quotes.author: Montaigne

tr_quotes.quote: Şaşma felsefenin temeli, soruşturma gelişmesi, bilgisizlik son aşamasıdır.
tr_quotes.author: Montaigne

tr_quotes.quote: Bilirken susmak, bilmezken söylemek kadar kötüdür.
tr_quotes.author: Platon

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe bir ağaç gibidir, kökleri metafizik, gövdesi fiziktir. Gövdeden çıkan kollar da öteki bütün bilimlerdir.
tr_quotes.author: Descartes

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, düşüncenin mikroskobudur.
tr_quotes.author: Victor Hugo

tr_quotes.quote: Felsefe, neleri bilmediğini bilmektir.
tr_quotes.author: Sokrates

tr_quotes.quote: Filozofların felsefesi, insanoğlunun zan ve şüphesini artırır. İslam’ın hikmeti ise, insanı yücelere ulaştırır.
tr_quotes.author: Mevlana

en_quotes.quote: Happiness is the feeling that power increases — that resistance is being overcome.
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en_quotes.quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.
en_quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

en_quotes.quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
en_quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

en_quotes.quote: I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires, rather than in attempting to satisfy them.
en_quotes.author: John Stuart Mill

en_quotes.quote: Why should we build our happiness on the opinions of others, when we can find it in our own hearts?
en_quotes.author: John-Jacques Rousseau

en_quotes.quote: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
en_quotes.author: Dalai Lama

en_quotes.quote: The secret of happiness, you see is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.
en_quotes.author: Socrates

en_quotes.quote: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
en_quotes.author: William James

en_quotes.quote: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
en_quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en_quotes.quote: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
en_quotes.author: Nicolas Chamfort

en_quotes.quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: May you live every day of your life.
en_quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

en_quotes.quote: Life is not a problem to be solved but a reality to be experienced.
en_quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

en_quotes.quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
en_quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

en_quotes.quote: If you hate a person, then you’re defeated by them.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go, as long as you do not stop.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
en_quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

en_quotes.quote: Never form a friendship with a man who is not better than you.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
en_quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

en_quotes.quote: When it is obvious that goals can’t be reached, don’t adjust the goals, but adjust the action steps.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
en_quotes.author: William James

en_quotes.quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Give instructions only to those people who seek knowledge after they have discovered their ignorance.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Looking at small advantages prevents great affairs from being accomplished.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: If they spit at you behind your back it means you’re ahead of them.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
en_quotes.author: Socrates

en_quotes.quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
en_quotes.author: Alan Watts

en_quotes.quote: No valid plans for the future can be made can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
en_quotes.author: Alan Watts

en_quotes.quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
en_quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en_quotes.quote: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
en_quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

en_quotes.quote: Eyes and ears are poor witnesses to people if they have uncultured souls.
en_quotes.author: Heraclitus

en_quotes.quote: If I cannot do great things, I can do small things in a great way.
en_quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

en_quotes.quote: Reason has always existed, but not always in a reasonable form.
en_quotes.author: Karl Marx

en_quotes.quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
en_quotes.author: William Shakespeare

en_quotes.quote: Life is like a piano. What you get out of it depends on how you play it.
en_quotes.author: Albert Einstein

en_quotes.quote: To know what people really think, pay regard to what they do rather than what they say.
en_quotes.author: René Descartes

en_quotes.quote: We do not describe the world we see. We see the world we can describe.
en_quotes.author: René Descartes

en_quotes.quote: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: You only learn when you give your whole being to something.
en_quotes.author: J. Krishnamurti

en_quotes.quote: The more sand had escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
en_quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

en_quotes.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
en_quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

en_quotes.quote: This fire that we call Loving is too strong for human minds. But just right for human souls.
en_quotes.author: Aberjhani

en_quotes.quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
en_quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

en_quotes.quote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
en_quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

en_quotes.quote: Love is simply the name for the desire and pursuit of the whole.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: The madness of love the greatest of heaven’s blessings.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
en_quotes.author: Lao Tzu

en_quotes.quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en_quotes.quote: Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you.
en_quotes.author: Erich Fromm

en_quotes.quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
en_quotes.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

en_quotes.quote: In dreams and in love there are no impossibilities.
en_quotes.author: Janos Arany

en_quotes.quote: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
en_quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

en_quotes.quote: Where there is love there is life.
en_quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

en_quotes.quote: No amount of anxiety makes any difference to anything that is going to happen.
en_quotes.author: Alan Watts

en_quotes.quote: The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude.
en_quotes.author: William James

en_quotes.quote: When anger arises, think of the consequences.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzche

en_quotes.quote: Conquer yourself rather than the world.
en_quotes.author: Rene Descartes

en_quotes.quote: Waking up to who you are requires letting go of who you imagine yourself to be.
en_quotes.author: Alan Watts

en_quotes.quote: Talk to yourself like you would to someone you love.
en_quotes.author: Brené Brown

en_quotes.quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
en_quotes.author: Francois Voltaire

en_quotes.quote: A man who has committed a mistake and doesn’t correct it, is committing another mistake.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Do not let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
en_quotes.author: Dalai Lama

en_quotes.quote: Nothing is so difficult as not deceiving oneself.
en_quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

en_quotes.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: The more you know, the more you know you don’t know.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Thinking. The talking of the soul with itself.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: It’s strange how simple things become, once you see them clearly.
en_quotes.author: Ayn Rand

en_quotes.quote: Dare to know! Have the courage to use your own intelligence.
en_quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

en_quotes.quote: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
en_quotes.author: William James

en_quotes.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
en_quotes.author: René Descartes

en_quotes.quote: He who thinks great thoughts, often makes great errors.
en_quotes.author: Martin Heidegger

en_quotes.quote: I think; therefore I am.
en_quotes.author: René Descartes

en_quotes.quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.
en_quotes.author: John-Jacques Rousseau

en_quotes.quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
en_quotes.author: Vincent van Gogh

en_quotes.quote: If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.
en_quotes.author: Emile Zola

en_quotes.quote: Any form of art is a form of power; it has impact, it can affect change – it can not only move us, it makes us move.
en_quotes.author: Ossie Davis

en_quotes.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
en_quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

en_quotes.quote: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
en_quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

en_quotes.quote: Art and love are the same thing: It’s the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.
en_quotes.author: Chuck Klosterman

en_quotes.quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Merton

en_quotes.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
en_quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

en_quotes.quote: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
en_quotes.author: Edgar Degas

en_quotes.quote: Happiness is the feeling that power increases â€” that resistance is being overcome.
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en_quotes.quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.

en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: You only learn when you give your whole being to something.
en_quotes.author: J. Krishnamurti

en_quotes.quote: The more sand had escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
en_quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

en_quotes.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
en_quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

en_quotes.quote: This fire that we call Loving is too strong for human minds. But just right for human souls.
en_quotes.author: Aberjhani

en_quotes.quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
en_quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

en_quotes.quote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
en_quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

en_quotes.quote: Love is simply the name for the desire and pursuit of the whole.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: The madness of love the greatest of heavenâ€™s blessings.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
en_quotes.author: Lao Tzu

en_quotes.quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en_quotes.quote: Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you.
en_quotes.author: Erich Fromm

en_quotes.quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
en_quotes.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

en_quotes.quote: In dreams and in love there are no impossibilities.
en_quotes.author: Janos Arany

en_quotes.quote: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
en_quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

en_quotes.quote: Where there is love there is life.
en_quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

en_quotes.quote: No amount of anxiety makes any difference to anything that is going to happen.
en_quotes.author: Alan Watts

en_quotes.quote: The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude.
en_quotes.author: William James

en_quotes.quote: When anger arises, think of the consequences.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzche

en_quotes.quote: Conquer yourself rather than the world.
en_quotes.author: Rene Descartes

en_quotes.quote: Waking up to who you are requires letting go of who you imagine yourself to be.
en_quotes.author: Alan Watts

en_quotes.quote: Talk to yourself like you would to someone you love.
en_quotes.author: BrenÃ© Brown

en_quotes.quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
en_quotes.author: Francois Voltaire

en_quotes.quote: A man who has committed a mistake and doesnâ€™t correct it, is committing another mistake.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Do not let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
en_quotes.author: Dalai Lama

en_quotes.quote: Nothing is so difficult as not deceiving oneself.
en_quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

en_quotes.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: The more you know, the more you know you donâ€™t know.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Thinking. The talking of the soul with itself.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: Itâ€™s strange how simple things become, once you see them clearly.
en_quotes.author: Ayn Rand

en_quotes.quote: Dare to know! Have the courage to use your own intelligence.
en_quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

en_quotes.quote: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
en_quotes.author: William James

en_quotes.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
en_quotes.author: RenÃ© Descartes

en_quotes.quote: He who thinks great thoughts, often makes great errors.
en_quotes.author: Martin Heidegger

en_quotes.quote: I think; therefore I am.
en_quotes.author: RenÃ© Descartes

en_quotes.quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.
en_quotes.author: John-Jacques Rousseau

en_quotes.quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
en_quotes.author: Vincent van Gogh

en_quotes.quote: If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.
en_quotes.author: Emile Zola

en_quotes.quote: Any form of art is a form of power; it has impact, it can affect change â€“ it can not only move us, it makes us move.
en_quotes.author: Ossie Davis

en_quotes.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
en_quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

en_quotes.quote: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
en_quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

en_quotes.quote: Art and love are the same thing: Itâ€™s the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.
en_quotes.author: Chuck Klosterman

en_quotes.quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Merton

en_quotes.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
en_quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

en_quotes.quote: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
en_quotes.author: Edgar Degas
